body: $ZIM "In the case of a special dividend of 25% or more
column3: special rules that are quite different apply. If you sell stock after the record date but before the ex-dividend date
column4: your shares will be sold with a book entry sometimes called a "due bill
column5: " which denotes that (though the company will pay the dividend to your account
column6: if you are the shareholder of record on the date two business days prior to the record date)
column9: turn the amount of that dividend over to the buyer of your stock. Conversely
column10: if you buy stock after the record date but before the ex-dividend date of a large special dividend
column11: you are entitled to the dividend and will receive it via the due bill process." Source Wikipedia "Special_dividend" article.
